text: three ways to follow up after a job
interview send something like this the
day after your interview thank you so
much for your time yesterday and for
giving me the chance to share my
interest and qualifications for the job
I particularly enjoyed learning about
how your company has a training program
for new employees that gives them the
overview of different units and career
paths I look forward to hearing from
you if you haven't heard back from the
hiring manager within a week of the time
frame they gave you you can send
something like this I wanted to follow
up on my interview on this date for that
position I was wondering if you had any
news about the position I enjoyed our
discussion and getting to know more
about the
company of the companies I've engaged
with during my job search I was
particularly impressed by your
commitment to training and development I
felt that this growth mindset was a good
fit for my career aims please let me
know if there's any additional
information I can provide I'm excited
about the opportunity to work with you
at your
company if there's a big change to your
situation before you hear back send
something like this I wanted to follow
up with you on my interview on this date
for that position since we had a chance
to talk I received a job offer from
another firm however your role as a
leader in the field of this area along
with your commitment to developing the
careers of your employees is impressive
and I'm excited about the prospect of
working with you if you have any news
about the position I would like to know
as I evaluate the offer I'm consider
considering
